item.title: Harvard Hits Back at Education Secretary McMahon, Denying Political Bias
item.description: Harvard University fired back at US Education Secretary Linda McMahon, denying her allegation that the school has a partisan political bias and warning that government “overreach” is threatening key freedoms.
item.dc:creator: Janet Lorin

media:content.media:description: Harvard University merchandise at a store in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

item.title: Hamas Frees Israeli-US Hostage Ahead of Trump’s MidEast Visit
item.description: Hamas freed American-Israeli hostage Edan Alexander on Monday in a hastily announced move ahead of US President Donald Trump’s visit to the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Alisa Odenheimer, Dan Williams, Sherif Tarek

media:content.media:description: Edan Alexander Photographer: Hostages and Missing Families Forum/AP Photo

item.title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Pans Trump’s Afrikaner Refugee Program
item.description: Dozens of White Afrikaners are due to arrive in the US on Monday, the first beneficiaries of a controversial resettlement program that was instigated by President Donald Trump, who is meeting with South African leaders next week.
item.dc:creator: Akayla Gardner, Katlego Mtshali

media:content.media:description: Cyril Ramaphosa Photographer: Phill Magakoe/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Floats Joining Possible Ukraine-Russia Talks in Turkey
item.description: US President Donald Trump raised the possibility of flying to Turkey on Thursday to join potential conversations over the war in Ukraine between Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Russia’s Vladimir Putin.
item.dc:creator: Akayla Gardner

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump outside the West Wing of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, May 8, 2025. Trump hailed the election of Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost as the pope, the first US national ever to be head of the Catholic Church, and said he looked forward to meeting him.

item.title: Greenlander Takes Helm of Arctic Council as Tensions Simmer
item.description: The body that fosters collaboration and climate science at the top of the world is under geopolitical pressure.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Bochove, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth

media:content.media:description: The Royal Danish Navy warship HDMS Vaedderen sails past sea ice off the coast of Nuuk, Greenland, on April 2.

item.title: Thiam Steps Down as Leader of Ivory Coast Opposition Party
item.description: Tidjane Thiam, the former chief executive officer of Credit Suisse Group AG, quit as head of Ivory Coast’s main opposition party after his leadership was challenged in court.
item.dc:creator: Kamailoudini Tagba

media:content.media:description: Tidjane Thiam

item.title: Modi Says India’s Reaction Is ‘New Normal’ in Pakistan Relations
item.description: India will not hesitate to use force to neutralize terrorist camps in Pakistan as it draws a “new normal” in relations with its neighbor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Anup Roy, Sankalp Phartiyal

media:content.media:description: Indian paramilitary soldiers patrol along a street in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, on May 12, 2025.

item.title: House Tax Bill Draft Calls for $30,000 SALT Deduction Limit
item.description: The House tax committee’s draft bill to renew President Donald Trump’s tax cuts calls for increasing the state and local tax deduction to $30,000 for couples, but limits the write-off to households earning $400,000 or less, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC.

item.title: GOP Starts Crucial Week With Tax, Spending Issues Unanswered
item.description: House Republicans are struggling to resolve key issues with President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax package after weekend talks, including a change in the deduction cap for state and local taxes and a potential hike in the rate for high earners.
item.dc:creator: Billy House

media:content.media:description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Republican from Louisiana, center, speaks to members of the media while arriving at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, April 28, 2025. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and congressional Republicans are meeting to sketch out the plan for passing a multi-trillion tax cut in the coming weeks as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House’s handling of the economy. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg

item.title: Newsom Urges California Cities to Ban, Remove Homeless Camps
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom called on cities to ban and remove homeless encampments from sidewalks, bike paths and other public property, ratcheting up the state’s effort to tackle the crisis.
item.dc:creator: Alicia Clanton

media:content.media:description: Gavin Newsom, governor of California, during a news conference with the US Army Corps of Engineers in Altadena, California, US, on Tuesday, Feb. 11, 2025. The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) will begin removing fire debris starting Tuesday from private properties damaged or destroyed by the January wildfires, officials announced Monday.

item.title: Americans Hit the Road as Economic Fears Discourage Flying
item.description: Kristin Herman and her partner had been planning a European getaway with stops in Paris and Rome, but with the US economy suddenly wobbling, the couple instead drove to Oregon’s nearby redwood forests and Cannon Beach — even camping some nights to save on hotels.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Nathan Risser

media:content.media:description: Traffic moves along Interstate 80 in Emeryville, California, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 27, 2024. AAA projects 79.9 million travelers will head 50 miles or more from home over the Thanksgiving holiday travel period. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Says He Won’t Use Qatari Jet After Leaving Office
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would not use a luxury jet being offered by the Qatari government after leaving office amid criticism over his administration’s consideration of using the plane as the next Air Force One.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai, Benedikt Kammel, Akayla Gardner

media:content.media:description: A 13-year-old private Boeing aircraft that President Donald Trump toured takes off from Palm Beach International Airport in West Palm Beach.

item.title: Petro to Sign China Investment Deal as Beijing’s Influence Grows
item.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said he plans to sign up to China’s Belt and Road initiative, potentially boosting Beijing’s growing influence while further souring his relationship with the US.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago

media:content.media:description: Gustavo Petro, Colombia’s president, at the Catatumbo Social Pact in Tibu, Norte de Santander department, Colombia, Thursday, March 6, 2025. Colombia will spend 2.7 trillion pesos ($657 million) to fund programs to replace illicit coca crops and finance food production, as the government seeks solutions to the security crisis in the country's Catatumbo region.

item.title: Senegal Seeks to Woo $1.7 Billion Investment for Digital Economy
item.description: Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye seeks to attract $1.7 billion of investments to build digital infrastructure and create more job opportunities for the country’s youth.
item.dc:creator: Yinka Ibukun

media:content.media:description: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, Senegal’s president, speaks during his inauguration ceremony in Diamniadio, Senegal, on Tuesday, April 2, 2024. Senegal’s opposition politician Faye was sworn in as president on Tuesday, becoming the youngest elected African leader less than three weeks after he was released from prison to run in the election last month.

item.title: Trump Says He May Speak to Xi This Week After Tariffs Truce
item.description: US President Donald Trump said he would likely speak to Chinese leader Xi Jinping later this week following talks between Washington and Beijing to temporarily lower tariffs and de-escalate the trade war between the world’s two largest economies.
item.dc:creator: Akayla Gardner

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump speaks during a press conference in the Roosevelt Room of the White House, on May 12.

item.title: US Said to Welcome EU Proposal to Cooperate on Economic Security
item.description: The US has welcomed European Union proposals to cooperate on mutual investments and economic security challenges, while continuing to provide little clarity on the possible outcomes of trade negotiations between the two sides, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: Employees work on a VW Golf on the assembly line at the Volkswagen AG factory in Wolfsburg, Germany, on Thursday, May 23, 2024. Auto sales in Europe rose 12% in April as manufacturers including Volkswagen AG and Renault SA benefited from robust demand for plug-in and conventional cars in several major markets.

item.title: After Driving Down Oil, Saudi Arabia’s MBS Looks for Trump Dividend
item.description: Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's MBS both want to monetize their relationship. It just might not be in the way Trump had envisaged.
item.dc:creator: Sam Dagher

media:content.media:description: Mandatory Credit: Photo by Ukrainian Presidency/SIPA/Shutterstock (14368321b) Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Crown Prince and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud in Saudi Arabia During a working visit. Ryad, SAUDI ARABIA-27 February 2024 (Ukrainian Presidential Press Office via SIPA) SIPA PRESS PROVIDES ACCESS TO THIS PUBLICLY DISTRIBUTED HANDOUT PHOTO PROVIDED BY UKRAINIAN PRESIDENTIAL PRESS OFFICE Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy Working visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Ryad - 27 Feb 2024

item.title: Xi Defiance Pays Off as Trump Meets Most Chinese Trade Demands
item.description: Xi Jinping’s decision to stand his ground against Donald Trump could hardly have gone any better for the Chinese leader.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy, Fran Wang, Yujing Liu

item.title: Sara Duterte Allies Outperform in Race for Philippine Senate
item.description: Allies of Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte are outperforming in the early count for the Senate election, an unexpected setback for President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. that boosts his deputy’s chances of surviving an upcoming impeachment trial and remaining eligible to run for the presidency in 2028.
item.dc:creator: Andreo Calonzo, Neil Jerome Morales

media:content.media:description: Sara Duterte

item.title: GOP to Claw Back Biden’s Climate Law to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
item.description: US House Republicans plan to help pay for an extension of President Donald Trump’s massive tax cuts by clawing back unused funds from scores of programs and grants in his predecessor’s signature climate law.
item.dc:creator: Ari Natter

item.title: Trump’s Ukraine Push Comes to a Head With Challenge to Putin
item.description: Donald Trump’s effort to secure peace in Ukraine is reaching a decisive moment with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy challenging Vladimir Putin to engage in talks this week.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Skolimowski, Daryna Krasnolutska

media:content.media:description: Ukrainian servicemen fire an M109 howitzer toward Russian positions, in an undisclosed area, in the eastern Donetsk region, on April 23, 2025.

item.title: Trump Wants Medicare to Pay Less Than Foreign Countries for Drugs
item.description: President Donald Trump is attempting to slash drug prices for Americans by more closely aligning their costs to lower prices paid abroad, renewing and expanding upon a failed push from his first term.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohrs Zhang

media:content.media:description: A pharmacy technician checks a prescription at a pharmacy in Midvale, Utah.

item.title: Poland to Shut Second Russian Consulate Over Sabotage Claims
item.description: Poland ordered the closure of the Russian consulate in Krakow after saying it has proof that a large fire in the country’s capital last year was ordered by Moscow’s secret services, according to the Polish foreign minister.
item.dc:creator: Maciej Martewicz

media:content.media:description: Smoke over the Marywilska 44 shopping center in Warsaw on May 12, 2024.

item.title: Detained Duterte Set for Mayoral Win Ahead of ICC Trial in Hague
item.description: Ex-Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is leading in the local election in his clan’s stronghold south of the country, even as he awaits trial in the Netherlands for alleged crimes against humanity.
item.dc:creator: Andreo Calonzo

media:content.media:description: Rodrigo Duterte during a campaign rally in Hong Kong on March 9, days before his arrest. Photo by Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Casts Netanyahu Adrift With Shifts on Iran, Houthis, Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would normally celebrate a hostage release such as that taking place on Monday, though in this case the deal with Hamas is another sign US President Donald Trump is starting to make decisions without him.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Bronner

media:content.media:description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu

item.title: Albania’s Premier on Track to Win Unprecedented Fourth Term
item.description: Albania’s premier is on track to win an unprecedented fourth term as he vowed to finally take the Adriatic country into the European Union and cement its status as a tourist destination.
item.dc:creator: Gresa Kraja

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Edi Rama casts his vote during parliamentary elections in Tirana, Albania, on May 11. Photographer: Vlasov Sulaj/AP Photo

item.title: UK and EU Haggle Over Fish and Food Days Before Reset Summit
item.description: Britain and the European Union are still trying to resolve disagreements over fisheries and food checks just a week before a summit in London where Prime Minister Keir Starmer plans to announce a major reset in post-Brexit relations.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: Fishermen in the English Channel from the Port of Newhaven.

item.title: The Recession Chatter Is Getting Louder. Watch These Metrics
item.description: We’ve built a dashboard to help you figure out if we’re headed for a downturn.
item.dc:creator: Reade Pickert, Mark Glassman

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump with his “reciprocal tariffs” chart during an event in the White House Rose Garden on April 2.

item.title: Medicaid Work Requirements Sought to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
item.description: House Republicans want to impose work requirements on some Medicaid recipients up to 64 years old and impose more costs on some beneficiaries to help pay for President Donald Trump’s planned sweeping tax package.
item.dc:creator: Billy House, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erik Wasson

item.title: France’s Lombard Wants Broader Tariff Disarmament After US-China Trade-War Reprieve
item.description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard welcomed the 90-day hiatus in the US-China trade war, but said more efforts are needed to de-escalate global tariff tensions.
item.dc:creator: William Horobin, Kamil Kowalcze, Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniel Basteiro

media:content.media:description: Eric Lombard, France's finance minister, at the EU Ministers for Economic and Financial Affairs (ECOFIN) and Central Bank Governors informal meeting in Warsaw, Poland, on Friday, April 11, 2025. Europe’s decision to ramp up defense spending after years of neglect is the right choice, according to European Union finance ministers. Photographer: Damian Lemanski/Bloomberg
